intro: Nemum parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered nemum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. The plant has finely divided, fern-like leaves that are aromatic and often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. Due to its medicinal properties, it has been historically valued for its potential health benefits.
